meanings.definition: A small organelle near the nucleus in the cytoplasm of most eukaryotic cells, containing the centrioles.
meanings.sent1: Centrosomes help in cell division by organizing the centrioles.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study centrosomes to understand cell structure better.
meanings.sent3: The centrosomes in the cell were having a party near the nucleus.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas acted as centrosomes, guiding the team towards success.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the centrosomes looked like tiny command centers.

meanings.definition: A small region of cytoplasm adjacent to the nucleus in most animal cells and involved in the formation of the mitotic spindle.
meanings.sent1: During cell division, centrosomes play a crucial role in spindle formation.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the movement of centrosomes in the cell.
meanings.sent3: The centrosomes in the cell were gossiping about the nucleus.
meanings.sent4: Her determination acted as centrosomes, guiding her towards her goals.
meanings.sent5: The centrosomes resembled tiny factories producing spindle fibers.
